definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: But to what did they owe the convulsion and rapture of their transport?
sentences.chinese: 但这令他们抽风着迷的挪移，他们靠的是什么？

sentences.english: Filtering protection waste gas exhaustion system.
sentences.chinese: 过载保护功能，废气抽风系统。

sentences.english: The other wild card here, as always, is Denver.
sentences.chinese: 另个一变数，正是那个常年抽风的丹佛掘金。

sentences.english: The ventilation fan switch on the button panel does not work here.
sentences.chinese: 掣板上的抽风机开关掣在这里并不能运作。

sentences.english: The exhaust fan has external motor and aluminum alloy blades, is explosion resistant and safe.
sentences.chinese: 抽风机是外置式电机，铝合金风叶，防爆，安全。

sentences.english: Extraction trunks must be positioned appropriately.
sentences.chinese: 抽风设备必须放置在合适位置。

sentences.english: It is usually used Suction chassis in front of, behind and at the top of the ventilation.
sentences.chinese: 通常采用的做法是机箱的前面吸风，后面和顶部抽风。

sentences.english: If the flue overdraws, all the heat goes right up the chimney.
sentences.chinese: 如果风管抽风过度的话，热量就会从烟囱直接跑掉了。

definition: (slang) (pun on 神經病|神经病[shen2 jing1 bing4]) crazy person/nutjob
to short-circuit/(fig.) to have a mental lapse/to get one's wires crossed/to be addled
sudden movement of a corpse (superstition)/fig. sudden torrent of abuse
(lit.) to have taken the wrong medicine/(fig.) (of one's behavior etc) different than usual/abnormal
